channel.title: How do i run 508s
channel.description: Guys when ever i run a 508 it says about 6 lines then it Exits. I have no idea whats going on. I code 317s all the time but i always have a problem with 508 Running.. Please help me!

item.title: How do i run 508s
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

Really Confused Still sorry. If you have msn add me please jakee_bj@hotmail.com and show me over teamviewer if thats alright?

Read full topic

item.title: How do i run 508s
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:6, topic:369117”]@echo off
Title Rune-JynX
cd …/bin
color 5
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” bulby/server 43594
PAUSE[/quote]
yep, its trying to find your server.class, make sure the directory is right
“cd…/bin” is the folder to look into, just to clear it up for you, bulby/server is the folder it is in, so remember find your server.class and fix were it finds that .class file

Read full topic

item.title: How do i run 508s
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:4, topic:369117”]Ill add more detail 1 sec.
Edit: [quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=465246.msg3402364#msg3402364 date=1290044856]
well im guessing its a classpath error, e.g. "cannot find class ‘main’ ", meaning it cant find the file to start with, usually the main file, you get what im saying?
you have to fix the classpath in your run.bat code
[/quote]
Thats What happens it says cannot find main and crap then says execption blah blah blah… Know what i mean? i have no idea how to fix it :/[/quote]
like i said, fix the file that initiates first in 508s, its saying it cant find the .class file that starts everything up, which again, is probably the server class file. if you could fix were the run batch finds the starting class file, that would fix your problem, again, i cant remember what file that is, but if you post your run batch code, i could tell you.

Read full topic

Erm, it’s the same as 317s in that sense. Add a pause to the end of the run batch file.
